message: Should I buy IntelliJ IDEA instead of WebStorm and RubyMine? Does it include both (as plugins)? Does it get the same updates when they get it?

data.message:
I know you may checked those links before, i am just trying to help until someone with more exp. helps you.

1- http://devnet.jetbrains.com/docs/DOC-1146

2- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13827214/can-intellij-idea-encapsulate-all-of-the-functionality-of-webstorm-and-phpstorm

3- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3768593/if-i-have-idea-do-i-need-rubymine-for-ruby-dev-or-will-it-do-both

Thanks. From link 2 it seemed the updates arrive very very late to IntelliJ, which made me hesitant on it. I tweeted it a few minutes before asking this question but haven't got comments yet. I guess my main question is how practically they keep the plugins and actual IDEs in sync.

I'm also not sure what they mean by simpler settings and opening from folder not being supported. I wonder whether it's possible but is an edge case to use IntelliJ for these, or is common and not exactly adventurous.

They Webstorm account replied to me and said that IntelliJ includes both, and that RubyMine includes WebStorm

https://twitter.com/Meligy/status/496552395568996353
https://twitter.com/WebStormIDE/status/496561893243629568
The interesting bit to this: It means RubyMine and PyCharm support NodeJS!

So, it is confirmed that RubyMine is fully inclusive of WebStorm, and IntelliJ IDEA has most RubyMine features (except ones shared with AppCode, and except simplified project/folder options, and maybe other things).
The question remains, *in practice* is it a good idea to just get IDEA? Anyone here made the decision to buy both IDEA and RubyMine (or to not do so)? How did that go?
